item.description: US-20/US-26 East (Broadway Ave.) at I-84/US-30 Jct in Boise. Turn right for I-84/US-30 West; continue over freeway for I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 East. This interchange was redesigned as a SPUI in 2015.

item.title: I-84 East (Exit 54) Offramp at Broadway Ave. (US-20/US-26)
item.description: I-84 East (Exit 54) Offramp at Broadway Ave. (US-20/US-26) in Boise. Turn left for US-20/US-26 West/Broadway Ave. to Boise State University, Convention Center, and City Center. Turn right for Industrial Park.

item.description: I-84 east at Exit 54 - Broadway Ave. I-84/US-30 continues east to Mountain Home. US-20 and US-26 join I-84 eastbound here.

item.title: I-84 West - Exits 53 and 54
item.description: I-84 west at Exit 54 - US-20/US-26/Broadway Ave. Approaching Exit 53 - Vista Ave./Boise Airport. US-20/US-26 leave I-84 here.

item.title: US-26 West/US-89 South - Alpine Junction
item.description: US-26 West/US-89 South at Alpine Junction. Turn right for US-26 West to Idaho Falls (ID) and the (Wyoming) Port of Entry. Turn left for US-89 south to Alpine, Afton, and Salt Lake (Utah).

item.title: US-26 West/US-89 South - Alpine Junction
item.description: US-26 West/US-89 South at Alpine Junction. Alpine Junction is the name of the intersection of US-89 and US-26, which is across the Snake River from the town of Alpine.

item.title: US-26 West/US-89 South at Split
item.description: US-26 West/US-89 South at split in Alpine Junction. Turn right for US-26 West; left for US-89 south.

item.title: US-26 West/US-89 South - Teton County
item.description: US-26 West/US-89 South in Teton County.

item.title: US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South in Hoback Jct. Roundabout
item.description: US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South in Hoback Jct. roundabout. Merge right for (US-26 West/US-89 South) Alpine Junction.

item.title: US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South - Roundabout
item.description: US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South entering roundabout at Hoback Junction. Use US-26 West/US-89 South for Alpine Jct.; use US-189/US-191 South for Pinedale. This intersection was converted to a roundabout in 2012.

item.title: US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South - Routes Divide
item.description: US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South - Routes Divide. Approaching Hoback Jct., where US-189/US-191 separate from US-26/US-89. The Routes Divide sign in Wyoming is common in this situation where one route splits from another route.

item.title: US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South at WY-391
item.description: US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South at WY-391 junction.

item.title: US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance Marker on US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South. Distance to Hoback Jct. and Pinedale (via US-191 South).

item.title: US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South in Jackson
item.description: US-26 West - US-89/US-189/US-191 South in Jackson. Two separate sign posts were used to hold all of the route shields.

item.title: I-84 East Exit 57 Offramp at ID-21
item.description: I-84 East Exit 57 Offramp at ID-21. Turn left for ID-21 east to Idaho City; turn right for Gowen Road.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 57
item.description: I-84 east at Exit 57 - ID-21/Idaho City/Gowen Road.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 57
item.description: I-84 east approaching Exit 57 - ID-21/Idaho City/Gowen Road.

item.title: I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 East Shields
item.description: I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 east shields. Four highways join together between Boise and Mountain Home, which is the most overlaps of any stretch of highway in Idaho. Notice the US highway shields are missing the surrounding black box. This stretch of highway was recently widened, and it was probably incorrectly placed by a contractor.

item.title: I-84 East - Exit 54
item.description: I-84 east at Exit 54 - Broadway Ave. I-84/US-30 continues east to Mountain Home. US-20 and US-26 join I-84 eastbound here.

item.title: US-20/US-26 East Split
item.description: US-20/US-26 east at US-20/US-26 split. US-26 continues east to Pocatello and Blackfoot, US-20 east goes to Idaho Falls.

item.title: US-20/US-26 East - EBR-1 Junction
item.description: US-20/US-26 East at junction to EBR-1 (Experimental Breeder Reactor - 1), which was the worlds first electricity generating nuclear power plant. EBR-1 is part of the Idaho National Laboratory (INL), and as scheduled tours for the general public. Also turn right for the RWMC (Radioactive Waste Management Complex) at the INL.

item.title: US-20/US-26 East at ID-55
item.description: US-20/US-26 East at ID-55 in Boise.

item.title: US-20/US-26 East at ID-55
item.description: US-20/US-26 East at ID-55 (Eagle Road). Use ID-55 south for Meridian; use ID-55 north for Eagle and McCall. Continue east on US-20/US-26 East for Boise.

item.title: US-20/US-26 East - Entering Boise
item.description: Entering Boise on US-20/US-26 East. Boise is the capital and largest city in Idaho.

item.title: US-20/US-26 East at ID-16
item.description: US-20/US-26 East at ID-16. ID-16 between ID-44 and US-20/US-26 is the newly constructed Central Valley Expressway. Eventually ID-16 will connect to I-84 as a freeway.

item.title: US-20/US-26 East at ID-16 North
item.description: US-20/US-26 East at ID-16 north to Emmett. Continue east on US-20/US-26 for Boise.

item.title: US-20/US-26 East Approaching ID-16
item.description: US-20/US-26 east approaching ID-16 east in Ada County. ID-16 was extended from ID-44 to US-20/US-26 in the summer of 2014.

item.title: US-20/US-26 East - Ada County
item.description: Entering Ada County on US-20/US-26 east.

item.title: US-20/US-26 East at I-84 West
item.description: US-20/US-26 East at I-84 West in Caldwell. Use I-84/US-30/US-20/US-26 West for Ontario (Oregon). Continue east for US-20/US-26 to Boise.

item.title: I-84 East at US-20/US-26 - Exit 29 Offramp
item.description: I-84 East (Exit 29) offramp at US-20/US-26 (Franklin Road). US-20/US-26 leaves I-84 here, and turns east into Boise. Turn left for US-20/US-26 to Boise. Turn right for Franklin Road to College of Idaho and Caldwell Event Center.

item.title: 10th St. East at I-84 East
item.description: 10th St. East at I-84 East to Ontario, and Portland. This is one of the few instances of Portland used as a control city on I-84.

item.title: 10th St. East at I-84 East
item.description: 10th St. East at I-84 East (Exit 28). Turn right on I-84 for Nampa and Boise. Continue east on 10th St. for I-84 East to Ontario (Oregon).

item.title: US-20/US-26 West at OR-201
item.description: US-20/US-26 west at OR-201 in Nyssa. Turn left for OR-201 south; OR-201 north US-20/US-26 west to Cairo Jct. outside of Ontario.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West - Nyssa
item.description: US-20/US-26 West in Nyssa. This is the first US-20/US-26 shields westbound in Oregon. In the last few years, standard Speed Limit signs have been appearing in Oregon. Normally, Oregon Speed Limit signs omit the word limit, and have larger numbers.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West - Snake River
item.description: US-20/US-26 West at the Snake River. The Snake River marks the boundary between Oregon and Idaho, starting just south of here.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West - End Snake River Canyon Scenic Byway
item.description: End Snake River Canyon Scenic Byway on US-20/US-26 West, approaching the Oregon state line. This is the only End sign I have seen for a Scenic Byway in Idaho.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West - Apple Valley Road
item.description: US-20/US-26 west at Apple Valley Road. The Snake River Canyon Scenic Byway joins US-20/US-26 westbound here.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West at ID-16
item.description: US-20/US-26 West at ID-16. ID-16 between ID-44 and US-20/US-26 is the newly constructed Central Valley Expressway. Eventually ID-16 will connect to I-84 as a freeway.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West at ID-16 North
item.description: US-20/US-26 West at ID-16 North to Emmett.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West Approaching ID-16
item.description: US-20/US-26 West approaching ID-16 in Ada County.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West Approaching ID-16
item.description: US-20/US-26 West approaching ID-16. ID-16 was recently extended from ID-44 (State St.) to US-20/US-26 (Chinden Blvd.) in July of 2014.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West - Boise
item.description: US-20/US-26 (Chinden Blvd.) West in Boise, just west of Eagle Road.

item.title: US-20/US-26 West at ID-55
item.description: US-20/US-26 west at ID-55 in Boise.

item.description: US-20/US-26 (Chinden Blvd.) West approaching ID-55 (Eagle Road) in Boise.

item.description: US-20/US-26 West (Chinden Blvd.) at ID-55 (Eagle Road) in Boise. Turn right on ID-55 north for Eagle and McCall. Turn left for ID-55 south to Meridian. Continue west for US-20/US-26 to Caldwell.

item.description: End ID-44 south (Glenwood St.) at US-20/US-26 (Chinden Blvd.). Turn right for US-20/US-26 west to Caldwell; left to Boise.

item.description: US-26/US-93 at ID-75 in Shoshone. Turn right for US-26 East/US-93 North to Arco and Idaho Falls. Continue straight for ID-75 to Sun Valley.

item.description: US-26 east at US-93 in downtown Shoshone. US-26 joins US-93 northbound to Arco.

item.description: ID-46 north at US-26. Turn right on US-26 east for Shoshone; left on US-26 west for Bliss. Continue north on ID-46 for Fairfield.

item.description: ID-46 North approaching US-26 in Gooding.

item.description: Entering Lincoln County on US-26 east.

item.description: I-84 - Exit 137 Offramp at Pioneer Road. Merge left for Pioneer Road. Continue straight for US-30 to Bliss and Buhl.

item.description: BL-84 west approaching I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 in Mountain Home. This is the western end of the Mountain Home business loop.

item.description: I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 east at Exit 95 - US-20 East/To BL-84/Mountain Home/Fairfield. It is unclear why this sign lists I-84 with the text TO, because BL-84 joins I-84 at this interchange. US-20 leaves I-84 eastbound.

item.description: US-20/US-26 east approaching I-84/US-30 onramp.

item.description: US-20/US-26 East in Nyssa.

item.description: US-20/US-26 West (Broadway Ave.) approaching Front St. US-20/US-26 traffic need to get in the left lanes to turn onto Front St.

Continue past intersection for US-20 east towards Fairfield. This is the east end of the Mountain Home business loop.

item.description: BL-84 east approaching I-84/US-20 junction (Exit 95) in Mountain Home.

item.description: I-84 west Exit 129 offramp. Turn right for King Hill.

item.description: US-97 south approaching US-26 in Madras.

item.description: I-205 north approaching Exit 9 - US-26/Powell St./Division St. Use Exit 19 for Gresham and the DMV. Distance marker for two approaching Exits - Glisan St. (Exit 21A) and I-84/US-30 West/Portland (Exit 21B).

item.description: OR-8 west at OR-217 north. Use OR-217 north for US-26; use OR-217 south for I-5.

item.description: OR-8 west approaching OR-217 north to US-26. Continue through the underpass for OR-217 south.

item.description: US-26 east offramp at OR-8 split. Use left lane for OR-8 for Canyon Road and West Slope. Use right lane for US-26 West/Beaverton/Hillsboro.

item.description: US-26 west at Exit 71A - OR-8/Canyon Road.

item.description: US-26 West approaching Exit 71B - Sylvan. Truck traffic, including Exit 71A bound truck traffic, need to use the right truck lane. Also a sign on the bridge lists the Beaverton Exits - Canyon Road, ORE Hwy. 217, and Cedar Hills Road.

item.description: US-26 west at Exit 72 - Zoo/Forestry Center. Access to the Portland Zoo and Washington Park.

item.description: Offramp from I-405 to US-26 west at 12th Ave. interchange. Stay in left lanes for US-26 West/Ocean Beaches/Beaverton. Speed limit is 50 MPH. This speed limit sign is one of the newer style speed limit signs seen on Oregon freeways, with the word LIMIT included.

item.title: I-405 North - Exits 1D and 2A
item.description: I-405 north at Exit 1D - US-26 West/Beaverton. Approaching Exit 2A - Salmon St./JELD-WEN Field. Also a sign for the next two exits on I-405 North - Everett St./Glisan St. and US-30 West.

item.title: I-405 North - Exit 1D
item.description: I-405 north at Exit 1D - US-26 West/Beaverton.

item.title: I-405 North - Exits 1B and 1C
item.description: I-405 north at Exit 1B - 4th Ave. Approaching Exit 1C - 6th Ave. Next two exits along I-405 north are US-26 West and Salmon St.

item.title: I-405 North - Exits 1B and 1C
item.description: I-405 north approaching Exit 1B - 4th Ave and Exit 1C - 6th Ave. Also, there is a warning against hazardous material traffic on US-26 west through the Sunset Tunnel.

item.description: I-5 south at the I-405 split in Portland. Use left lane for I-405 North/US-26 West/Beaverton. Use right lane for I-5 South/Salem. This exit ramp is on the end of the Marquam Bridge over the Willamette River.

item.description: Entering Unity Oregon on US-26 east.

item.description: Distance marker on US-26 east to Unity and Vale.

item.description: End OR-245 West at US-26. Use US-26 west for Burns, John Day, and Prairie City. Use US-26 east for Unity, Vale and Ontario.

item.description: I-25 North at Exit 188B, WY-220 Jct. Turn left for WY-220 West towards S. Poplar St., Fort Casper, and Nicolaysen Art Museum. Turn north on Poplar St. for the Casper Planetarium.

item.description: I-25 North at Exit 188B - WY-220 West/Poplar St. Approaching Exit 189 - US-20/US-26 West/Shoshoni. Continue north on I-25/US-87 North for Midwest.

item.description: I-25 north at Exit 188A - Center St. Approaching Exit 188B - WY-220 West/Poplar St. Center St. is the northern end of Business I-25 and Business US-87.

item.description: I-25/US-87 North/US-20/US-26 West Exit 187 onramp in Casper.

item.title: I-25 North - Exits 187 and 188A
item.description: I-25/US-87 North/US-20/US-26 West at Exit 187 - Mc Kinley St. Approaching Exit 188A - Center St.

item.description: I-25 South/US-20 East/US-26 East/US-87 South at Bryan Stock Trail. US-20/US-26/US-87 leave I-25 south here. Turn left to return north on I-25 towards Midwest and Shoshoni.

item.title: I-25 South at Bryan Stock Trail (Exit 186)
item.description: I-25 South/US-20 East/US-26 East/US-87 South at Bryan Stock Trail. US-20/US-26/US-87 leave I-25 south here. Turn right for US-20/US-26 west and US-87 south. Continue ahead for I-25 south for Cheyenne.

item.title: I-25 South Approaching Exit 186
item.description: I-25/US-87 South/US-20/US-26 East approaching Exit 186 - US-20/US-26 East/US-87 South/North Beverly St./Bryan Stock Trail. I-25 continues south towards Cheyenne.

item.description: I-25 south approaching Exit 187 - McKinley St. Approaching Exit 186 - US-20 East/US-26 East/US-87 South/N. Beverly St./Bryan Stock Trail. I-25 continues south towards Cheyenne.

item.title: I-25 South - Exits 188A and 187
item.description: I-25 south at Exit 188A - BL-25/BL-87/Center St. Approaching Exit 187 - McKinley St. Exit 187 is signed as I-25 and US-87 south, but this is an error. Neither highway exit at McKinley St.

item.title: I-25 South - Exits 188B and 188A
item.description: I-25 south at Exit 188B - WY-220 West/Poplar St. Approaching Exit 188A - BL-25/BL-87/Center St.

item.description: I-25/US-87 South at Exit 187 - US-20/US-26 West/Shoshoni/Port of Entry. Approaching Exit 188B - WY-220 West/Poplar St. Also approaching Exit 188A - BL-25 South/Center St. US-20/US-26 join I-25/US-87 south through Casper at this interchange.

item.title: I-25 South - Exit 189
item.description: I-25/US-87 South - Exit 189 - US-20/US-26 West/Shoshoni/Airport. US-20/US-26 joins I-25 south through Casper.

item.description: To continue south on US-287 South/US-26 East turns turn right Dubois.

item.description: Distance marker on US-26 East/US-191 North to Yellowstone and Dubois. The sign is a wooden style common inside both Grand Teton and Yellowstone National Park. This marker is just inside Grand Teton National Park.

item.title: US-26 East/US-191 North at Jackson Hole Airport
item.description: US-26 East/US-191 North at Jackson Hole Airport in Grand Teton National Park.

item.description: End BL-84 east at I-84, Exit 90 onramps. Use I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 east for Twin Falls; use I-84/US-20/US-26/US-30 west for Boise. This is the western end of the Mountain Home business loop.

item.description: US-20 west at I-84/US-26/US-30. BL-84 begins here and heads into Mountain Home.

item.description: US-20 West approaching I-84 and BL-84. BL-84 was recently shortened, and rerouted to end at Exit 95 instead of Exit 99. This is now the western end of BL-84 in Mountain Home.

item.description: US-20 West/US-26 West/US-93 South approaching US-20 split.

item.description: US-20/US-26 west at US-93. Use US-93 north for Mackay. Use US-20/US-26 west/US-93 south for Twin Falls and Boise.

item.description: US-20/US-26 west approaching US-93

item.description: US-26 west/BL-15 south at I-15 Exit 116. Use I-15 north for Idaho Falls and Butte. Use I-15 South/US-26 West for Blackfoot and Pocatello.

item.description: Northern end of US-91 north at US-26 and BL-15. US-91 was recently extended, when US-26 was rerouted to the new Exit 116 interchange on I-15.
